title: Barn F.C.
text:
Barn Football Club is a former Irish <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Carrickfergus">Carrickfergus</a>, <a href="County%20Antrim">County Antrim</a>. It was founded in 1889 by workers in the James Taylor & Co. cotton mill, known as the Barn Mills, in Carrickfergus. The club entered the Irish Junior Cup for the first time in 1890–91 and the <a href="County%20Antrim%20Shield">County Antrim Shield</a> in 1891–92, in which they reached the semi-final. In 1923, Barn was elected to an expanded <a href="Irish%20Football%20League">Irish Football League</a>, but retained membership only for five seasons. Financial difficulties meant that the team played the <a href="Irish%20League%201927%E2%80%9328">1927–28 season</a> with a squad made up entirely of amateurs, finishing second bottom, and folding at the season's end The club's ground was the <a href="Taylors%20Avenue">Barn Field</a>, later known as Taylors Avenue.
<a href="Barn%20United%20F.C.">Barn United</a>, founded in 1954, took their name from Barn and continue to play in the same area.
